NINTH GRADE PROJECTS!




Project Name Driving Question Final Deliverables Challenge Student Review
Cultivating Community DRIVING QUESTION: How can we become a force of change in our community in order to make natural spaces a priority? -Images and detailed descriptions portfolio of your -Your section of the final proposal and brief indicating the value and need for more green spaces in our community. -Your participation and contribution to the final documentary film as evidence of needs and potentials of incorporating green spaces. When you step through your door and look around at your community, what do you see? Do you see an urban oasis? Do you see nature filtering through the cracks in the pavement? For this project, we will be examining our home communities and our school community in order to accept the inherent beauty that already exists and to identify the areas of change that need to happen. You will work independently to document images of these places and then work collaboratively with a group to create a proposal, a documentary, and a DVC community garden space. I honestly enjoyed this project a lot. It gave me the chance to learn more about the importance of green spaces and how I can contribute to the bettering of my earth. I was also greatful that I was able to be hands on when it came to creating a greenspace my freshman year.
-Jennifer'Lyn Johnson, Classof 2018
Be Heard DRIVING QUESTION: What positive movements are happening in the world that need to be highlighted and celebrated? ---Individual: -Positive Movements Research -Poetry -Song Lyrics -Song Podcast -Analytical Poetry Portfolio ---Group: -Group Music Video -Production Role -Day of Production Role -Group Participation -Assessment This year we have explored what histories make us who we are, injustices in the world, and the positive effects of green spaces. We also know that words and music together have the power to communicate ideas to enormous audiences. For this project part of your challenge is to identify positive events, people, and/or movements that are making positive changes in the community or world. Additionally, you will write and create a song or poem to perform in front of the class. Finally, the class will then decide on one song for which to create a music video that conveys a celebration of the good in our world. I thought it was a fun way to express myself. I felt that it was something that everyone can do. I believe that everyone has a creative side and this project gave us the opportunity to explore that side.
-Arryana Sandoval, Class of 2018
